1 भारत test

remove_non_ascii[source]

remove_non_ascii(df, n=None)

Remove all methods that contain non-ascii characters from a given pandas dataframe, not in-place.

:param df: the pandas dataframe containing each method to be beautified :param n: the number of methods to evaluate. If none, the entire dataframe will be used :returns: returns a new dataframe without methods that contain non-ascii characters

{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
NON_ASCII_DF = pd.DataFrame(['this is a test'], columns = ['code'])
df_non_ascii = remove_non_ascii(df_fake)

assert (NON_ASCII_DF == df_non_ascii).all().all()

        }

        this.pipelines = new com.amazonaws.internal.SdkInternalList<Pipeline>(pipelines);
    }
    '''
], columns = ['code']); df_fake
code
0 public void setPipelines(java.util.Collection<...

beautify_code[source]

beautify_code(df, n=None)

Beautify the methods in a pandas dataframe using uncrustify with the sun.cfg style, i.e., Oracle's style, not in-place.

:param df: the pandas dataframe containing each method to be beautified :param n: the number of methods to evaluate. If none, the entire dataframe will be used :returns: returns a modified dataframe with the methods beautified

{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
BEAUT_MTHD = '''public void setPipelines(java.util.Collection<Pipeline> pipelines) {
    if (pipelines == null) {
	this.pipelines = null;
	return;
    }
    this.pipelines = new com.amazonaws.internal.SdkInternalList<Pipeline>(
	pipelines);
}
'''

df_beaut = beautify_code(df_fake)

assert BEAUT_MTHD == df_beaut.code.values[0]
{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
df_fake = pd.DataFrame(['>>> > + public ++ \n\n \t \t \t\t  '], columns = ['code']); df_fake
code
0 >>> > + public ++ \n\n \t \t \t\t

replace_special_tokens[source]

replace_special_tokens(df, spec_toks, n=None)

Replace all the special tokens in a pandas dataframe.

:param df: the pandas dataframe containing each method to replace special tokens in :param n: the number of methods to evaluate. If none, the entire dataframe will be used :returns: returns a modified dataframe with the special tokens replaced

{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
REPLACED_MTHD = '<triple_greater> <greater> <+> <public> <++> <n><n> \t \t \t\t  '
df_replaced = replace_special_tokens(df_fake, java_special_tokens)

assert REPLACED_MTHD == df_replaced.code.values[0]
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
fake_data = '<triple_greater> <greater> <+> <public> <++> <n><n>'
{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

train_tokenizer[source]

train_tokenizer(df, n=None, vocab_sz=20000, min_freq=2, output=None)

Train a ByteLevel BPE tokenizer on a given pandas dataframe. Code adapted from https://github.com/huggingface/tokenizers/tree/master/bindings/python.

:param df: the pandas dataframe containing each method to have the tokenizer train on :param n: the number of methods to evaluate. If none, the entire dataframe will be used :param vocab_sz: the maximum vocabulary size of the trained tokenizer :param min_freq: the minimum frequency a token has to occur to be considered :returns: returns a trained ByteLevel BPE tokenizer

{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
TOKENIZED_SPEC = [
    '<triple_greater>', 'Ġ', '<greater>', 'Ġ', '<+>', 'Ġ',
    '<public>', 'Ġ', '<++>', 'Ġ', '<n>', '<n>'
]
tokenizer = train_tokenizer(df_fake)
encoded = tokenizer.encode(fake_data)

assert TOKENIZED_SPEC == encoded.tokens
{% endraw %}
